intro: Nicotiana copiapina, commonly known as the Copiapó tobacco, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
